summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and defense counsel regarding the logistics of producing discovery materials in the case United States v. Maxwell. The emails discuss sending hard drives via FedEx to defense counsel, to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for Ghislaine Maxwell, and to Colorado, as well as uploading materials to USAfx.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as a recipient of discovery materials sent to Colorado.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as a recipient of the email regarding discovery production.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), for whom discovery materials are being sent to the MDC.

connections.description: Laura Menninger is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery materials related to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jeff Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery materials related to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Production Logistics
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office coordinates the production of discovery materials to defense counsel and to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC via FedEx and USAfx.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated November 20, 2021, concerning the production of discovery materials in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).
Materials were being sent via FedEx to defense counsel Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca, and a separate drive with a password was sent to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
The prosecution also uploaded materials to USAfx, a file-sharing system, for defense counsel access.
The correspondence highlights the logistical challenges and time-sensitive nature of sharing discovery, including missed FedEx pickup deadlines.
The document references specific Bates number ranges (SDNY_GM_02774100-SDNY_GM_02774104) that could not be uploaded initially.
